diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Adjustment disorder with disturbance of emotions and conduct, alcohol use disorder, mild cognitive disorder
diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Complications of DBS, mood and behavioral changes due to Parkinson’s disease, substance use disorders, medication side effects, dementia, primary mood or psychotic disorder, psychosocial conflict
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: Mr. R's mood and behavioral changes were attributed to psychological impacts of multiple stressors including worsening Parkinson’s disease symptoms, job loss, a lawsuit, and difficulties transitioning to home life. Additionally, excessive alcohol consumption was noted. The changes in his behavior did not consistently correlate with DBS programming changes.
